publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1204# Mr Keith Harding: Fife Council Education Overspend-That the Parliament expresses its concern over the projected £3.8 million overspend in Fife Council's education budget and the measures being undertaken to address this situation, which include cutting the budget for secondary schools in the Kingdom and doubling charges to pupils for musical instrument tuition. Supported by: Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh*

S1M-1204# Mr Keith Harding: Fife Council Education Overspend—That the Parliament expresses its concern over the projected £3.8 million overspend in Fife Council’s education budget and the measures being undertaken to address this situation, which include cutting the budget for secondary schools in the Kingdom and doubling charges to pupils for musical instrument tuition. Supported by: Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh, Nick Johnston*
S1M-1204# Fife Council Education Overspend (lodged on 21 September 2000) Phil Gallie*
S1M-1204# Fife Council Education Overspend (lodged on 21 September 2000) Alex Fergusson*
S1M-1204# Fife Council Education Overspend (lodged on 21 September 2000) David McLetchie*, Mr Jamie McGrigor*, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton*
S1M-1204# Fife Council Education Overspend (lodged on 21 September 2000) John Scott*

S1M-1204# Mr Keith Harding: Fife Council Education Overspend—That the Parliament expresses its concern over the projected £3.8 million overspend in Fife Council’s education budget and the measures being undertaken to address this situation, which include cutting the budget for secondary schools in the Kingdom and doubling charges to pupils for musical instrument tuition. Supported by: Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh, Nick Johnston, Phil Gallie, Alex Fergusson, David McLetchie, Mr Jamie McGrigor, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, John Scott
S1M-1204# Fife Council Education Overspend (lodged on 21 September 2000) Mr Brian Monteith*

S1M-1204# Mr Keith Harding: Fife Council Education Overspend—That the Parliament expresses its concern over the projected £3.8 million overspend in Fife Council’s education budget and the measures being undertaken to address this situation, which include cutting the budget for secondary schools in the Kingdom and doubling charges to pupils for musical instrument tuition. Supported by: Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh, Nick Johnston, Phil Gallie, Alex Fergusson, David McLetchie, Mr Jamie McGrigor, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, John Scott, Mr Brian Monteith, Mr David Davidson
S1M-1204# Fife Council Education Overspend (lodged on 21 September 2000) Tricia Marwick*

S1M-1204# Mr Keith Harding: Fife Council Education Overspend—That the Parliament expresses its concern over the projected £3.8 million overspend in Fife Council’s education budget and the measures being undertaken to address this situation, which include cutting the budget for secondary schools in the Kingdom and doubling charges to pupils for musical instrument tuition. Supported by: Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh, Nick Johnston, Phil Gallie, Alex Fergusson, David McLetchie, Mr Jamie McGrigor, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, John Scott, Mr Brian Monteith, Mr David Davidson, Tricia Marwick
S1M-1204# Fife Council Education Overspend (lodged on 21 September 2000) Mary Scanlon*
